author: ThioJoe
description:
Sponsored: Get your personal information removed from the web and search results by visiting ⇨ https://joindeleteme.com/ThioJoe and use code THIOJOE for 20% off

When you get a new computer, it usually takes a while to get it set up just the way you want. In this video I talk about stuff that is easy to miss, or you weren't aware of. I go over some specific and general settings that apply regardless of the operating system, as well as several Windows-specific settings. These also include both security settings and user preferences, and finally I talk about some more general tips and stuff to do beyond just changing settings.

Mentioned Links:
• Microsoft article to enable long file paths: https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/fileio/maximum-file-path-limitation?tabs=powershell#registry-setting-to-enable-long-paths
• WinUtil: https://github.com/ChrisTitusTech/winutil
• O&O ShutUp10: https://www.oo-software.com/en/shutup10

title: What You MUST Do When You Get a New PC (Or Right Now)
